key_points: The Guile-Emacs project aims to use Guile as the basis for Emacs's Lisp support.
Guile-Emacs has two main components: a new Lisp compiler and a variant of Emacs with Guile Elisp
The combination of these projects will improve performance, increase expressiveness, and reduce C reliance
Guile was chosen for its support for multiple languages using its compiler tower
Guile's compiler optimizations occur at the Tree-IL layer or lower
The project has a long history with previous implementation attempts dating back to the 1990s

technical_terms.context: Overview of Guile and its relation to Emacs Lisp
technical_terms.definition: A dialect of Lisp, and GNU's official extension language.
technical_terms.name: Scheme

technical_terms.context: Explanation of the Guile-Emacs project's components
technical_terms.definition: A new Emacs Lisp compiler built on top of Guile, and a variant of Emacs with Guile Elisp as its Lisp implementation.
technical_terms.name: Guile-Elisp

technical_terms.context: Description of the benefits of the Guile-Emacs project
technical_terms.definition: Improved performance, increased expressiveness for Elisp, and reduced C reliance.
technical_terms.name: Compiler tower

technical_terms.context: Explanation of Guile's support for multiple languages
technical_terms.definition: A system that allows adding support for a new language to Guile by writing a compiler from the source language to Tree-IL.
technical_terms.name: Tree-IL

technical_terms.definition: The process of optimizing compiler-generated code, which occurs at the Tree-IL layer or lower.
technical_terms.name: Compiler tower

technical_terms.context: Explanation of the Common Lisp Object System and its metaobject protocol
technical_terms.definition: A system that provides a way to implement objects and their behavior in a language.
technical_terms.name: GOOPS (Generic Object Protocol)

technical_terms.context: Description of the project's implementation strategy
technical_terms.definition: Implementing a core subset of Elisp, modifying the garbage collector and data structures for Lisp objects, and replacing the Lisp evaluator with Guile Elisp.
technical_terms.name: Internships
